author: Northern_Wind
title: Mountaineering Food Guide
text: # 1 Hi Friends, I need to know what kinda of food I can carry with myself if i am going for Alpine style climbing with my own camp stove and all. I have few peaks in my mind like Stok Kangri/Chamser Kangri which i want to do solo so the food needs to be very easy to carry( i mean not bulky packed and all) , very nutritious and high in calories and ofcourse most important should not take much time to cook. Few of them i can figure out are chocolate bars, dry fruits etc but mainly talking about foods which needs bit of cooking . I am expecting about 1kg-1.5kg of food for 3 days atleast to sustain myself in the mountains i know Rajma(kidney beans) are strict no no because they take lot of time to cook so Please suggest . Lot of experience mountaineers here for sure can share in some of their experience regarding food. Thank you.
